intro: [WRONG START] Astellia nivicola, commonly known as the snow astelia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Astelia nivicola is valued for its hardiness and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
